description: Dive into "Lonavala's Picture-Perfect Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Lonavala's Picture-Perfect Escapes

places.generalDescription: Shree Narayani Dham Temple is a serene Hindu temple located in Lonavala, offering a spiritual retreat amidst beautiful surroundings. The 4.5-acre complex features marble floors, rose gardens, and a spacious hall. In addition to its main deity, Ma Narayani, the temple also houses shrines for Lord Ganpati and Shree Salasar Hanuman.

sources.snippet: visiting places near lonavala one of tourist attractions in lonavala Shree Narayani Dham provides a spiritual retreat to tourists in Lonavala, all in presence of God. There are several facilities as the temple complex is spread over 4.5 acres. The most important, however, is the social aspect, Seva santhan and Shree Narayani Nari Chetna Kendra, through which activities are carried out for the upliftment of the society.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Lonavala

sources.snippet: Narayani Dham Temple | #18 of 25 Places to Visit in Lonavala. Situated in the heart of Lonavala, Narayani Dham Temple is one of the most popular Lonavala tourist places. This stunning temple complex is spread over an area of 4.5 acres and has a beautiful and well-maintained garden as well.
sources.shortName: 28 Best Places to Visit in Lonavala (2024) ‚úîTourist Places List

sources.snippet: Narayani Dham Temple is a beautiful temple built of white marble and is located in the heart of Lonavala. Dedicated to Goddess Narayani it is one of the best Lonavala sightseeing places. It is dedicated to the Goddess Narayani and is a famous religious spot for devotees.
sources.shortName: 55 Places to Visit in Lonavala 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Shree Narayani Dham Temple

reviews.text:
It is a beautiful temple and a must visit place if you're traveling to lonavala. Should visit in the evening as this place looks more beautiful with lightings and fountain.
Peaceful mandir shree sidhivinayak ganpati, maa narayani , and salaar balaji ,its very beautiful ‚ù§Ô∏è

They have food coupons where you get to eat unlimited satvik thali (check timings) as their coupon gets sold out very early also they have their traditional gond ladoo which is one thing you should not forget to take home.

Narayani Dham is truly a serene and divine experience nestled in the heart of Lonavala. From the moment you enter, you're greeted with stunning architecture, beautifully maintained gardens, and a sense of peace that's hard to find elsewhere. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Narayani and is a relatively new but grand structure with intricate carvings and a majestic aura.

The cleanliness and organization of the temple premises are impressive - everything from the shoe counters to the prasad area is well-managed. There's also a small gaushala (cow shelter), and the overall atmosphere is calm and spiritual.

A great plus is the temple's accommodation and dining facilities. The bhojanalaya serves simple, sattvic food that adds to the spiritual vibe of the place. It's an ideal spot not just for devotees, but also for anyone looking for a peaceful getaway amidst nature.

Well maintained and beautiful religious places where you will definitely feel the vibe and calm your mind and soul. Please book advance tickets for breakfast and lunch and they also provide accommodation with minimum cost and good facilities as compared to nearby hotels and resorts.

places.address: Plot No 28, 199, Tungarli Rd, near Kaivalyadhama, behind kailash parvath hotel, Tungarli, Lonavala, Maharashtra 410401, India

places.generalDescription: Aadishakti aai Ekvira Devi Temple is a hillside Hindu temple located near Karla Caves in Maharashtra, offering stunning valley views. It dates back to the 2nd century BCE and is associated with the ancient Pandava era. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Ekvira, considered an incarnation of Goddess Renuka in Hindu scriptures. It holds great significance for the Aagri-Koli People, a local tribe of fishermen.

sources.snippet: Ekvira Devi Temple is an enchanting hilltop temple dedicated to Goddess Ekvira and held in high reverence by the fishing community here, the Koli community. This is a very old temple and it is located near the Karla Caves. The structure dates back to the 2nd Century BCE. There are over 200 man-made steps leading up to the temple.
sources.shortName: 55 Places to Visit in Lonavala 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions
70 Places To Visit In Lonavala For A Refreshing Getaway

places.name: Aadishakti aai Ekvira Devi Temple

reviews.text:
The temple of Mata Ekvira on the hill. so beautiful place. The huge caves are beside there from one of those temple is situated I guess.
waiting period in queue like 30-45 min.
Visit early in the morning to avoid crowds & feels peace.

Aai Ekvira Devi Temple and Karla Caves is a beautiful blend of spirituality and history. Located atop a small hill near Lonavala, the temple is a sacred place for devotees, especially from the Koli community. Be ready for a moderate climb of around 200 steps, but the divine energy and scenic view at the top make it totally worth it.

Adjacent to the temple are the ancient Karla Caves-Buddhist rock-cut caves dating back over 2000 years. The main chaitya (prayer hall) with its massive pillars and carved details is breathtaking. The whole area offers a peaceful and spiritual experience with a touch of history and nature.

Tips:

Visit early in the morning to avoid crowds and heat.

Wear comfortable shoes.

Local food and refreshments are available at the base.

A must-visit spot if you're in or around Lonavala!

üåø "Ekvira Devi Temple is not just a place of worship, but a serene blend of devotion and nature. Surrounded by lush greenery and the peaceful hills of Lonavala, it's a divine experience that touches the soul. A must-visit for both spiritual seekers and nature lovers." üôè

places.address: Ekvira Devi Rd, Karla, Maharashtra 410405, India

places.generalDescription: Karla Caves, located in Lonavala, Maharashtra, are ancient rock-carved cave temples that once housed a Buddhist monastery. Dating back to around 2000 years ago, these caves feature soaring halls, statues, intricate columns, and pillars that recite history. The site is associated with the Mahasamghika sect of Buddhism and is one of the oldest rock-cut cave complexes in India.

sources.snippet: Not too far from Bhaja Caves lies another popular tourist attraction ‚Äì Karla Caves that houses the largest and most well preserved Hinayana Buddhist Chaitya in the country. Associated with Mahasamghika sect of Buddhism, these are one of the oldest rock-cut caves in India with the oldest one dating back to the 1 st century BCE. You will be amazed to see fine motifs, sculptures, inscriptions, stupas, pillars and 37-pillar aisle at Karla Caves that boasts of over 2000-year-old beams, amongst which some of them are still alive.
sources.shortName: 28 Best Places to Visit in Lonavala (2024) ‚úîTourist Places List

sources.snippet: Another group of ancient caves making it to our curated list of best tourist places in Lonavala are the Karla caves. Located around 11 km from Lonavala, these Buddhist caves are just as significant historically as the Bhaja caves. With origins dating back to as old as the second to fifth century BC, these caves hold immense historical knowledge of the Buddhist culture in terms of sculptures and carvings.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places to visit in Lonavala Post Lockdown

sources.snippet: Karla caves are close to Bhaja Caves and are one of India's most popular tourist attractions. When you plan a vacation in Maharashtra, make sure that you visit Karla Caves in your stay, as it is one of the finest places well preserved Hinayana Buddhist Chaitya in India. Karla's caves are similar to Bhaja Caves, as it is one of the oldest caves backdated in the 2nd and 5th century BC.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Lonavala

sources.snippet: Karla Caves is a popular tourist attraction that doubles up as a pre wedding shoot location as well. These caves are some of the oldest rock-cut caves in the country and are home to the Hinayana Buddhist Chaitya. They are lined with beautiful motifs and inscriptions and also have stupas, sculptures, and a 37-pillar aisle.
sources.shortName: 11 Beautiful Pre Wedding Shoot Locations in Lonavala

sources.snippet: Karla Caves are ancient Buddhist rock-cut caves and a famous tourist attraction located near Lonavala. It is one of the oldest Buddhist cave shrines in India. These caves houses one of the largest Chaityas (prayer hall with a stupa) in India.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Lonavala
70 Places To Visit In Lonavala For A Refreshing Getaway

places.name: Karla Caves

reviews.text: Ancient Buddhist rock cut caves near Lonavala. The stone sculpture, wooden works and other cravings are breathtaking. The rock cut staircase is a must see in the cave structure. We have trek all the way to the cave which is next to the Ekvira Devi Temple entrance. Parking is available at the foothills. Usually crowded as it is very near to the temple. Easily accessible entrance.

Good historical place. Do not go with your vehicle till the top. Park your vehicle at bottom parking space. Hire auto from there to go up. There are many stirs to climb so not recommended for old people with health issues.  There is holy temple next to cave. Best place to visit during monsoon.

The rock-cut architecture, carved from a single stone, is simply breathtaking. Every sculpture tells a story - from the finely detailed deities and dancers to the massive elephants and guardians that stand tall even after centuries.

The intricate carvings are so well preserved that you can almost feel the devotion and craftsmanship of the artisans who created them. The scale of the temple leaves you awestruck - towering walls, endless panels of mythological scenes, and the sense of standing inside history itself.

places.address: Ekvira Devi Rd, Karla, Lonavala, Maharashtra 410405, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the Mumbai-Pune highway, Mapro Garden in Lonavala is a delightful destination reminiscent of its counterpart in Mahabaleshwar. The garden boasts charming strawberry-themed decor and an expansive area dedicated to showcasing and selling Mapro products such as jams, chocolates, and syrups. Visitors can easily spend an hour exploring the garden's lush surroundings while indulging in photography sessions.

sources.snippet: visiting places near lonavala one of tourist attractions in lonavala Shree Narayani Dham provides a spiritual retreat to tourists in Lonavala, all in presence of God. There are several facilities as the temple complex is spread over 4.5 acres. The most important, however, is the social aspect, Seva santhan and Shree Narayani Nari Chetna Kendra, through which activities are carried out for the upliftment of the society.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Lonavala

places.name: Mapro Garden

reviews.text:
Entrance is excellent and having enough space for parking.  Cleanliness is good and that really attracts. They give lots of discounts on their products and free sampling for taste.
Fun zone activity is also available that makes people mood fresh. Toilets are Clean .Mapro is really good space for chocolates etc.

I recently visited here and it was a wonderful experience. The place is very beautiful with a peaceful and refreshing atmosphere. The food is really good and fresh, and I especially enjoyed the variety they offer. It's a perfect spot to relax, enjoy delicious food, and spend time with friends or family. Definitely worth visiting! ‚ù§Ô∏èüòç

An must small pit stop on old mumbai-pune highway!!! Spacious parking available and very big ambiance of garden. Entrance and cleanliness is top notch by management. They offer multiple products on marginal discounts. Must by some fruit jams and syrups. They offer tastes samples as well. Please check the offers before buying anything otherwise you will end up taking it on billing counter

places.address: Sr no 3 & 4, Old Mumbai - Pune Hwy, Valvan, Lonavala, Maharashtra 410403, India

places.generalDescription: Sunset Cafe Lonavala Khandala Rajmachi Point 0702 is a popular tourist spot in Lonavala, offering a picturesque view of the hills and a larger landscape compared to nearby attractions. Visitors can enjoy stunning views of Lonavala, including the lake and waterfall with a river running through the valley during monsoon season. Many travelers from Mumbai take a break at this highway cafe to witness the beautiful sunset around 7 o'clock.

sources.snippet: best sunset point in lonavala khandala picnic spot places to visit in lonavala and khandala This is famous because people travel from Mumbai to Lonavala will take break here on the highway to see sunset view, its clearly beautiful from khandala point and Lonavala sunrise point time is around 7'clock, khandala visiting places
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Lonavala

places.name: Sunset cafe lonavala Khandala rajmachi point 0702

reviews.text: Best & Under rated Cafe in Lonavala/Khandala. Would recommend this cafe anytime. Best during Sunset & Monsoon. Veg Maggi & Chocolate Maggi is must try.

This is underrated and unexplored cafe i would say so far as I visit here 1st time and it was empty, but for sure the place is 100% beautiful you can enjoy the rainy weather plus khandala ghat.

The menu here will be basic but yea good to go. Prices are also minimum.

I ordered sandwich, French fries and coffee which were decent as per the place.

The only difficulty is parking as i have faced.

Must visit this cafe once

A hidden gem

Found this cozy little spot while driving along the highway one rainy evening, and it's now my favourite stop in Lonavala. Sunset Cafe isn't fancy , it's more like a small kitchen in the clouds , but that's exactly what makes it special.

It's run by a single vendor, who's super kind and humble. There's a nice little garden outside, and the view of the foggy clouds and hills is absolutely magical. The peaceful vibe makes it perfect for a quiet tea break with family.

I tried the corn pizza and sandwiches, both were tasty, and the coffee was warm and comforting in the rain. The fog rolling through the hills while sipping tea or coffee is something you just have to experience.

Highly recommend stopping here if you want a break from the highway rush and a moment of peace with nature.

places.address: Old Mumbai Pune Highway, point, Khandala, rajmachi, Lonavala, Maharashtra 410301, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the serene Sahyadri mountains, Gagangiri Ashram is a peaceful and spiritual complex founded by Mahayogi Shri Gagangiri. Surrounded by lush greenery and bisected by a flowing river, the ashram offers a tranquil atmosphere perfect for meditation and self-reflection. The accommodations are simple yet comfortable, emphasizing the spiritual journey over luxury. Visitors can enjoy delicious vegetarian meals with an emphasis on clean and healthy eating.

sources.snippet: If you want to spend the day in a peaceful and serene environment then Gagangiri Ashram is just the place for you. This Ashram is a place where Mahayogi Shri Gagangiri lived and meditated. Gagangiri Ashram is surrounded by wonderful greenery which is well maintained.
sources.shortName: 55 Places to Visit in Lonavala 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Gagangiri Ashram

reviews.text: Visited here with my old parents. If you want some peace in your life, please visit here. Try to experience the trekking towards the Hill Cave Temple. Don't forget to buy coupons for lunch prasadam .Highly recommended.

We visited Gagangiri Ashram, nestled in the heart of nature, and had an incredible experience!
The serene surroundings and peaceful ambiance made for a perfect getaway from the hustle and bustle of city life.
The ashram's natural setting, with its lush greenery and tranquil atmosphere, was rejuvenating and calming.
We had a wonderful time exploring the premises, practicing yoga, and rejuvenating our spirits.
The hospitality and warmth of the ashram's staff added to the overall experience.
Gagangiri Ashram is a haven for those seeking peace, nature, and spiritual growth.

Nice quaint place along side running stream. The water flow has good speed so please take care and avoid going into the flow. Also take care of the children. The entire ashram area is full of greenery and taking blessings of Gagangiri Maharaj is a beautiful experience. Please do not make noise here as lot of devotees are doing Dhyan here and experiencing calmness of the ashram. Please avoid taking pictures inside the temple premises.

places.generalDescription: Zenith Waterfall is a stunning mountain waterfall situated near Khopoli, Lonavala. It's a popular tourist attraction known for its breathtaking scenic surroundings, especially during the monsoon season. Visitors can reach the waterfall by train to Khopoli railway station and then walk or take an auto for 3km. If traveling by car, it's possible to drive directly to the base of the waterfall and then walk 400-500 meters to reach it.

sources.snippet: Zenith Waterfall is a beautiful mountain waterfall located near Khopoli, Lonavala. It is one of the best Lonavala tourist attractions and popular for its amazingly wonderful scenic surroundings. It draws a lot of visitors, especially during the monsoon season.
sources.shortName: 55 Places to Visit in Lonavala 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: ZENITH WATERFALL

reviews.text:
"Located in the heart of the Western Ghats, the Zenith Waterfall is a breathtaking natural wonder that left me awestruck. This stunning waterfall, situated near the town of Amboli in Maharashtra, is a must-visit destination for nature lovers and adventure seekers.

As I approached the waterfall, I was struck by its sheer beauty. The water cascades down a rocky cliff, creating a misty veil that surrounds the entire area. The roar of the waterfall is almost deafening, and the cool mist on my skin was a welcome respite from the summer heat.

What I loved most about the Zenith Waterfall was its serene and peaceful atmosphere. The surrounding area is lush and green, with dense forests and rolling hills that seem to stretch on forever. It's the perfect spot to relax, unwind, and connect with nature.

The waterfall is also a popular spot for trekking and hiking, with several trails that offer breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. However, be sure to exercise caution when approaching the waterfall, as the rocks can be slippery and the water currents can be strong.

Overall, the Zenith Waterfall is a breathtaking natural wonder that is sure to leave you spellbound. Whether you're a nature lover, an adventure seeker, or simply looking for a peaceful retreat, this stunning waterfall is a must-visit destination." 5/5 stars.

‚ÄúUnforgettable Escape to Zenith Waterfall!‚Äù

What a hidden paradise! Zenith Waterfall offers a truly breathtaking view that feels straight out of a movie. The short 15-minute trek is not only easy but also filled with greenery and calm vibes - perfect for anyone who loves nature. But the real highlight? Standing under the powerful waterfall and swimming in its cool waters - it's pure joy! A peaceful, refreshing, and soul-satisfying experience. Truly one of the best offbeat spots near Mumbai - highly recommended for a quick yet magical getaway!

Zenith waterfall is safest waterfall in khopoli area near lonavala. Its closed mostly on sunday.
There is no proper car parking here you just need to park on side of road. There are cahnging room available. Trekk is just for 15min and very easy . Please avoid throwing garbage and preserve nature. There are small food stall on the aoproach road where you can eat maggi pakoda vadapav tea ,corn and water etc.

places.address: Zenith, Dutta Mandir, Road, near Zenith High school, Zenith Colony, Khopoli, Maharashtra 410203, India

places.generalDescription: Lion Point, also known as Tigers Leap or Tigers Point, is a popular tourist spot in Lonavala, Maharashtra. Located 12km south of Lonalva, this hilltop lookout offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding countryside and mountains. Visitors can enjoy the lush green valley below and may even spot small waterfalls among the conical hills and deep valleys on clear days.

sources.shortName: 70 Places To Visit In Lonavala For A Refreshing Getaway

places.name: Lion Point

reviews.text: Absolutely stunning viewpoint! Lion's Point offers some of the best panoramic views in Lonavala, especially during the monsoon when the hills are lush and waterfalls are everywhere. The sunrise and sunset views are breathtaking. There are plenty of food stalls selling hot tea, corn, and snacks-perfect for enjoying the cool breeze. The area can get crowded on weekends, so I recommend going early in the morning or on a weekday for a more peaceful experience. Don't forget good shoes-the terrain can get slippery. A must-visit if you're in Lonavala!

It has mesmerizing view. It feels like walking on the clouds. Everything looks so dreamy.
The natural beauty of this place is tarnished by visitors, plastic wrappers, empty water bottles are thrown everywhere.
Lots of monkeys and cows are there. Visitors are advised not to approach the monkeys as they may snatch and run away with whatever is there in their hands.
Stalls for water, juices, especially fresh sugarcane juice and snacks is there. And everything starts from 30 RS onwards.
Camels and horses are there for riding, photographers are also there if you wish to have a hard copy of your memorable visit.
Seating arrangement is made (not free of cost) to sit and enjoy the view.
It's a must visit place.

Lion's Point is one of the most popular viewpoints in Lonavala, especially during monsoon. The drive up is beautiful, and once you reach the top you get wide views of valleys, waterfalls, and green hills all around. On a cloudy day, the mist rolling in makes it even more dramatic.

There are small stalls selling tea, corn, and snacks, which adds to the experience. The place does get crowded on weekends, and parking can be a little chaotic, but if you go early morning or on a weekday, it feels more peaceful.

Overall, it's a simple spot but the views make it worth the stop if you're in Lonavala.

places.generalDescription: Sunil's Celebrity Wax Museum in Lonavala is a family-friendly attraction showcasing lifelike wax figures of both Indian and international celebrities. It's a popular tourist spot in the city, along with other attractions like Lonavala and Valvan. The museum features replicas of famous personalities such as Amitabh Bachhan, A R Rahman, Charlie Chaplin, Hitler, and Rajnikanth.

sources.snippet: The pre-wedding photoshoot in Lonavala takes on a distinctive and humorous twist due to the Lonavala Celebrity Wax Museum. Adorable and creative poses can be made by couples next to lifelike wax replicas of their beloved celebrities. During their pre-wedding session, couples can capture amusing and unforgettable moments at this distinctive and entertaining location in Lonavala.
sources.shortName: Best 11 Pre Wedding Shoot Locations in Lonavala - VsnapU

sources.snippet: Sunil's Celebrity Wax Museum is a popular attraction and must visit place in Lonavala founded by a 38-year-old wax artist from Kerala, Sunil Kandalloor. It has almost 100 sculptures of famous celebrities like Rajiv Gandhi, Benazir Bhutto, Michael Jackson, Kapil Dev Adolf Hitler, AR Rahman, etc. It is located at a distance of 1 km from Lonavala Railway Station.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Lonavala

sources.snippet: Sunil‚Äôs Celebrity Wax Museum | #21 of 25 Places to Visit in Lonavala. Housing around 100 wax sculptures of celebrities from around the world, Celebrity Wax Museum is one of the most popular places to visit in Lonavala. Besides exploring the museum, you can also take pictures with the wax figures of your favourite celebrities here, such as A.R.
sources.shortName: 28 Best Places to Visit in Lonavala (2024) ‚úîTourist Places List

sources.snippet: Sunil's Celebrity Wax Museum is a popular attraction in Lonavala. It houses almost 100 sculptures of celebrities like Rajiv Gandhi, Benazir Bhutto, Michael Jackson, Kapil Dev Adolf Hitler, AR Rahman and many more. Image of Chhatrapati Shivaji is the highlight of the museum.
sources.shortName: 41 Best Places to visit in Lonavala

places.name: Sunil's Celebrity Wax Museum

reviews.text:
Sunil's Celebrity Wax Museum offers a uniquely Indian spin on the wax museum concept-imbued with regional flavor, artistic talent, and interactive fun. For art lovers and families, it's a creative stop to add to your Lonavala itinerary. Just be mindful of potential crowding and maintenance issues.

Tips for an Enjoyable Visit:
‚Ä¢	Go early on a weekday.
‚Ä¢	Prioritize photo ops quickly.
‚Ä¢	Combine your visit with nearby spots like Lion's Point or Karla Caves for a full day of exploration.

Overall, it's a worthwhile visit for its novelty and nostalgia, especially if you're curious to flaunt your selfie skills with your favorite icons-just go in with tempered expectations!

Sunil's Celebrated Wax Museum is a must-visit destination! The lifelike wax sculptures are incredibly realistic, and the exhibits are fascinating. Our guide Diya was knowledgeable and made the experience even more enjoyable.

The museum offers a unique glimpse into the world of wax art, with a wide range of exhibits that cater to all interests. The attention to detail and craftsmanship are impressive.

Highlights:

- Realistic wax sculptures
- Fascinating exhibits
-  A fantastic experience that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a unique and engaging outing!

Visited Sunil Celebrity Wax Museum ‚Äì A Fun and Memorable Experience!

This museum showcases wax statues of various great leaders and famous personalities. Some of them were so lifelike, I couldn't resist clicking pictures with them!

The location is convenient as it's inside a mall, and the overall vibe is fun and family-friendly. Your ticket (around ‚Çπ350) includes entry to three attractions: the Wax Museum, a Horror Show, and a 3D video game/vision experience ‚Äì making it a complete entertainment package!

And the best part? When you're done exploring and feeling a bit tired, there's a McDonald's nearby where you can grab a bite and relax.

Definitely worth a visit if you're looking for a mix of fun, excitement, and a few Insta-worthy moments!

places.address: Lonavala Junction, Lonavla Square Mall, Takve Kurth, Pune, Maharashtra 410401, India

places.generalDescription: Tungarli Lake, located near Lonavala, is a serene and picturesque spot popular for picnics, sunset watching, and photography. Surrounded by natural beauty, it offers a tranquil setting to unwind after a day of sightseeing. During the monsoon season, visitors can enjoy playing in the waterfalls near Tiger's Leap and exploring Bushy Dam.

sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Lonavala

sources.snippet: Nestled within the natural environs of Lonavala, Tungarli Lake is the best location for a pre-wedding shoot in Lonavala. The lake's quiet and beautiful atmosphere is enhanced by the stunning hills and an abundance of vegetation that surround it. Every photo is enhanced by the serene ambiance created by the sparkling rivers and blue skies above.
sources.shortName: Best 11 Pre Wedding Shoot Locations in Lonavala - VsnapU

sources.snippet: Among the most popular Lonavala tourist places is the Tungarli Lake. This hidden gem with a picturesque view and a serene ambiance attracts nature enthusiasts and romantic couples alike. A little recreational trip around the lake is the perfect way to refresh your mind and soul.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places to visit in Lonavala Post Lockdown

sources.snippet: Tungarli Lake is said to be the jewel in the heart of Lonavala in monsoon season. This secret jewel in the heart of Lonavala forms a perfect or flawless spot for a tedious escape from busy schedules. Bored of hotel stays, then book bungalows in Lonavala at affordable prices.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Lonavala
70 Places To Visit In Lonavala For A Refreshing Getaway

places.name: Tungarli Lake

reviews.text: We went to Tungarli Lake/Dam on 18th September 2024. As it was a weekend the place was not crowded. It was not raining but the place was lush with greenery, the climate was cool, windy and cloudy. The lake was serene and very clean. We were able to access the road which leads to a villa on the top of a nearby hill. The view from there is simply breathtaking.

A beautiful lake located on top of a hill in Lonavla and is a tourist attraction. To get to the lake, had to walk and climb a hill leading to the lake. However, there are some ruined British era barracks seen on the way. Upon reaching the lake, there are some small stalls selling corn on the cob. This lake is beautiful and tranquil during the monsoon season. There is a dam located at the side of this lake. Also, there is a ruined British era barrack near the lake. One can get amazing views of the surrounding area and enjoy the cool breeze as well. This is an ideal place for families, couples as well as friends. It is not recommended for senior citizens as the road to the lake is steep and difficult. Overall, it a good place and is a must visit. It should not be missed.

Road to the lake is bit steep and narrow. There is no such parking space. Had to park somewhere on the road.
No entry fees.
I had visited this place on a sunny afternoon. Nobody was there. Lake is very beautiful and peaceful. Water was looking green. And surrounding was clean and green too. Had a great time there.
There was a small shop selling water and maggi.
Best time to visit this place is during monsoon to witness greenery around.

places.address: Gold Valley Sector D, Gold Valley, Nandgaon, Lonavala, Maharashtra 410403

places.generalDescription: Kune Falls, located about 4 km from Lonavala and 2 km from Khandala Railway Station, is a picturesque waterfall nestled in the Sahyadri range. With its dramatic tiered structure and scenic mountain views, it's a popular spot for photography and adventure enthusiasts. The falls cascade down three levels amidst thick forests and mountain bluffs, offering an enchanting visual experience.

sources.snippet: lonavala places to visit A picturesque waterfall located in the heart of the Sahyadri range, Kune Falls is a popular spot for adventure enthusiasts and nature lovers.vKune Falls locates between the twin hills of Lonavla and Khandala. The region locates at an elevation of 622 m above sea level against the backdrop of the magnificent Sahyadri Mountains in western Maharash
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Lonavala

sources.snippet: Cascading from a height of 200 m, Kune Falls is one of the most spectacular waterfalls in the region. This three-tiered waterfall is set against the backdrop of lush green Sahyadri Mountains and is a visual treat for nature lovers. It is also the 14 th largest waterfall in the country and one of the best tourist places in Lonavala.
sources.shortName: 28 Best Places to Visit in Lonavala (2024) ‚úîTourist Places List

sources.snippet: Kune Waterfalls is one of the stunning waterfalls located at 622 m, present among the famous Sahyadri Mountains. This waterfall is situated near the Kune village in the Pune district of Maharashtra. This place attracts tourists in large numbers in the rainy season when the waterfall is at its peak and flows down heavily.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Tourist Places to Visit in Lonavala

sources.snippet: The Kune Falls, situated in Lonavala, are the fourteenth tallest waterfalls in India. It is the perfect spot for a pre-wedding photoshoot in Lonavala. Amidst the Sahyadri mountains, there lies a three-tiered waterfall.
sources.shortName: Best 11 Pre Wedding Shoot Locations in Lonavala - VsnapU

places.name: Kune Falls

reviews.text: Beautiful location.. many small waterfalls and a huge one too.. th location on Google is not exactly precise but once you reach there ask locals and you'll be at the waterfalls. Use a vehicle with proper ground clearance.
One gets full view of the falls from Rajmachi point (Aug2022 pics).

One of the Beautiful place in Lonavla. Must visit place. But you can not go near this Kune waterfalls why because  it is under private property now. So we can see this from a distance at Khandala Monkey view point. The view is just Amazing. U can't get over from the view. You can find food stalls there and you can eat breakfast and lunch also.

places.address: Kune Village, Khandala, Lonavala, Kune N.m., Maharashtra 410301, India

places.generalDescription: Waghjai Devi Mandir, situated in the picturesque Tiger Valley, is a temple dedicated to Goddess Waghjai. What sets this temple apart is the unique idol of the goddess. The main festival celebrated here is Navaratri, marked by grand festivities. Visitors describe their experience as divine and pleasant, with a mystic darshan of the powerful deity. The architectural design is simple yet magnificent, providing devotees with a serene space for offering prayers.

sources.snippet: Waghjai Devi Temple is located in the beautiful Tiger Valley and it is dedicated to Goddess Waghjai. The unique feature about this temple is that the idol of the Goddess here is quite different from the idols of other temples. Navaratri is the main festival celebrated here with a lot of pomp and festivities.
sources.shortName: 55 Places to Visit in Lonavala 2025, Tourist Places & Attractions

places.name: Waghjai devi Mandir

reviews.text: Waghjai devi mandir in Lonavala -Khandala is situated in a serene and calm surroundings. The temple is quite popular and pilgrims get a soothing feel and blessings of the devi
Nice and calm place‚Ä¶.behind the temple there is place with a good view‚Ä¶you can also take photos there‚Ä¶.

Nice ambience in temple of Waghjai devi maa. Spent half an hour in the temple and also enjoy scenic view from temple campus.

This is in proximity of Khandala Ghat View point and should visit once to get blessing.

I was to able see nice view of Khandala railway station from the top.

places.address: Q9C8+W96, Tiger Valley, Khandala, Lonavala, Maharashtra 410301, India
